curam.core.impl

Class StartupSearchServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.core.base.StartupSearchServer
      • curam.core.impl.StartupSearchServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    curam.core.intf.StartupSearchServer

    public class StartupSearchServer
extends curam.core.base.StartupSearchServer
    This class contains methods that set up search server internal state.

    • Constructor Summary

      StartupSearchServer() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void doStartup()
      This method is a startup method that must be invoked by administrators when a search server is started (using the startupSearchServer ant target).
      static void setBatchMode()
      Call this before doStartup() to disable scheduled staging-->index `synchronization`.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StartupSearchServer

        public StartupSearchServer()

    • Method Detail

      • setBatchMode

        public static void setBatchMode()
        Call this before doStartup() to disable scheduled staging-->index `synchronization`. Useful for running the server from batch job or unit tests, i.e. outside of RMI or an AppServer.

      • doStartup

        public void doStartup()
               throws AppException,
                      InformationalException
        This method is a startup method that must be invoked by administrators when a search server is started (using the startupSearchServer ant target). It sets up internal state and populates `indices` ready for searching. No searches can be performed until this method has run successfully.
        Throws:
        AppException - In case the server startup is already in progress or the search service is locked or search service information could not be read.
        InformationalException - In case multiple errors occur during server startup.
